Token.Abstract: Represents a TMX Tilemap "map", ie global properties. The tilemap is usually created from a TMX file via the parseTMXFile method.
The size of the map, in tiles.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The size of the map, in tiles.

Token.Abstract: The size of the map, in tiles.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The size of the map, in tiles.

Token.Abstract: The size of the map, in tiles.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The size of the map, in tiles.

Token.Abstract: The size of tiles. Can be set in Tiled when a new tilemap is created. In the New Map dialog the gridSize is referred to as "Tile Size".

ReturnValue.Abstract: The size of the grid (tiles) in points.

Token.Abstract: The size of tiles. Can be set in Tiled when a new tilemap is created. In the New Map dialog the gridSize is referred to as "Tile Size".

ReturnValue.Abstract: The size of the grid (tiles) in points.

Token.Abstract: The size of tiles. Can be set in Tiled when a new tilemap is created. In the New Map dialog the gridSize is referred to as "Tile Size".

ReturnValue.Abstract: The size of the grid (tiles) in points.

Token.Abstract: This is the tileSize of the tileset with the largest tile size. Will be the same as gridSize for tilemaps whose tilesets all use the same tile size. But if you use tilesets of different tile sizes (ie 32x32 and 128x128) this will be the largest (ie 128x128). Mainly used internally to make sure tiles of all sizes properly appear on the screen and do not "pop in/out" near the screen borders. Valid only after tilesets have loaded their textures.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The largest tile size found in the tilesets used by this tilemap.

Token.Abstract: This is the tileSize of the tileset with the largest tile size. Will be the same as gridSize for tilemaps whose tilesets all use the same tile size. But if you use tilesets of different tile sizes (ie 32x32 and 128x128) this will be the largest (ie 128x128). Mainly used internally to make sure tiles of all sizes properly appear on the screen and do not "pop in/out" near the screen borders. Valid only after tilesets have loaded their textures.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The largest tile size found in the tilesets used by this tilemap.

Token.Abstract: This is the tileSize of the tileset with the largest tile size. Will be the same as gridSize for tilemaps whose tilesets all use the same tile size. But if you use tilesets of different tile sizes (ie 32x32 and 128x128) this will be the largest (ie 128x128). Mainly used internally to make sure tiles of all sizes properly appear on the screen and do not "pop in/out" near the screen borders. Valid only after tilesets have loaded their textures.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The largest tile size found in the tilesets used by this tilemap.

Token.Abstract: The map's global properties. Editable in Tiled from the menu: Map -> Map Properties.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The dictionary of properties.

Token.Abstract: The map's global properties. Editable in Tiled from the menu: Map -> Map Properties.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The dictionary of properties.

Token.Abstract: The map's global properties. Editable in Tiled from the menu: Map -> Map Properties.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The dictionary of properties.

Token.Abstract: The orientiation (type) of tilemap.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The map's KKTilemapOrientation.

Token.Abstract: The orientiation (type) of tilemap.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The map's KKTilemapOrientation.

Token.Abstract: The orientiation (type) of tilemap.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The map's KKTilemapOrientation.

Token.Abstract: The tilemap's background color. Seen only if there are empty tiles on all layers. Defaults to black.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The background color.

Token.Abstract: The tilemap's background color. Seen only if there are empty tiles on all layers. Defaults to black.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The background color.

Token.Abstract: The tilemap's background color. Seen only if there are empty tiles on all layers. Defaults to black.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The background color.

Token.Abstract: The highest valid gid from all tilesets. Updated when tilesets load their textures. Equal to the lastGid property of the "last" tileset. Mainly needed for bounds checks, don't change this value.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The highest-numbered (theoretical) gid considering all tilesets.

Token.Abstract: The highest valid gid from all tilesets. Updated when tilesets load their textures. Equal to the lastGid property of the "last" tileset. Mainly needed for bounds checks, don't change this value.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The highest-numbered (theoretical) gid considering all tilesets.

Token.Abstract: The highest valid gid from all tilesets. Updated when tilesets load their textures. Equal to the lastGid property of the "last" tileset. Mainly needed for bounds checks, don't change this value.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The highest-numbered (theoretical) gid considering all tilesets.

Token.Abstract: By how much to scale the tilemap if the app is running on an iPad device. Defaults to 1.0f (no scaling, ie iPad displays larger portion of the map). Recommended value: 2.0f.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The iPad scale factor.

Token.Abstract: By how much to scale the tilemap if the app is running on an iPad device. Defaults to 1.0f (no scaling, ie iPad displays larger portion of the map). Recommended value: 2.0f.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The iPad scale factor.

Token.Abstract: By how much to scale the tilemap if the app is running on an iPad device. Defaults to 1.0f (no scaling, ie iPad displays larger portion of the map). Recommended value: 2.0f.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The iPad scale factor.

Token.Abstract: If set to YES, will also scale each tileset's spacing & margin properties. This can be used if you simply upscale an iPhone tileset with an image program, which will also increase any existing spacing & margin accordingly. If you use a texture atlas program, it usually generates the same spacing and margin for all texture atlas files regardless of the contained image's scale factor. Defaults to NO (ie for use with a texture atlas program). Can be ignored for texture atlases which have neither spacing between tiles nor margin between outermost tiles and texture border.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Whether to also scale up spacing and margin if iPadScaleFactor is > 1.0.

Token.Abstract: If set to YES, will also scale each tileset's spacing & margin properties. This can be used if you simply upscale an iPhone tileset with an image program, which will also increase any existing spacing & margin accordingly. If you use a texture atlas program, it usually generates the same spacing and margin for all texture atlas files regardless of the contained image's scale factor. Defaults to NO (ie for use with a texture atlas program). Can be ignored for texture atlases which have neither spacing between tiles nor margin between outermost tiles and texture border.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Whether to also scale up spacing and margin if iPadScaleFactor is > 1.0.

Token.Abstract: If set to YES, will also scale each tileset's spacing & margin properties. This can be used if you simply upscale an iPhone tileset with an image program, which will also increase any existing spacing & margin accordingly. If you use a texture atlas program, it usually generates the same spacing and margin for all texture atlas files regardless of the contained image's scale factor. Defaults to NO (ie for use with a texture atlas program). Can be ignored for texture atlases which have neither spacing between tiles nor margin between outermost tiles and texture border.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Whether to also scale up spacing and margin if iPadScaleFactor is > 1.0.

Token.Abstract: Applies the iPadScaleFactor property. You only need to call this if you're creating a tilemap from scratch at runtime, after your map was completely set up. And only if you actually use iPadScaleFactor other than the default.
Parse and create a KKTilemap from a file. The file must be in TMX format.

Parameter.Name: tmxFile
Parameter.Abstract: The name of a TMX file in the bundle, or an absolute path to a TMX file in a non-bundle directory.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new instance of KTTilemap initialized with the contents of the TMX file.

Token.Abstract: Creates an empty tilemap. Use this if you want to create your tilemap world entirely in code.

Parameter.Name: mapSize
Parameter.Abstract: The size of the tilemap, in tiles.

Parameter.Name: gridSize
Parameter.Abstract: The grid size (tile size of the tilemap.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new, empty instance of KTTilemap.

Token.Abstract: Writes the tilemap to a file path. The resulting file will be in TMX format.

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: An absolute path to a file in a writable directory (ie AppData or Documents).

Token.Abstract: List of tilesets (KKTilemapTileset used by this map.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of KTTilemapTileset objects.

Token.Abstract: List of tilesets (KKTilemapTileset used by this map.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of KTTilemapTileset objects.

Token.Abstract: List of tilesets (KKTilemapTileset used by this map.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of KTTilemapTileset objects.

Token.Abstract: Adds a tileset to the list of tilesets. Only needed when creating or changing a tilemap at runtime.

Parameter.Name: tileset
Parameter.Abstract: The tileset to add to the tilemap.

Token.Abstract: Returns the tileset for a specific gid. Mainly to access that tile's properties. Will return nil for invalid gids (gid that points to a non-existing tileset, or if gid is 0).

ReturnValue.Abstract: The tileset the gid is part of, or nil if the GID is out of bounds.

Token.Abstract: The name of a tileset as displayed in Tiled.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name of a tileset as displayed in Tiled.

ReturnValue.Abstract: the tileset with the given name. Returns nil if there's no tileset with this name.

Token.Abstract: Replaces a tileset with another (actually: it creates an alias) so that tiles drawn with the originalTileset will now be drawn using the otherTileset. This can be used to change the atmosphere of the tilemap, perhaps by changing from summer to winter, from "before attack" to "after attack", and so on.

Parameter.Name: originalTileset
Parameter.Abstract: The tileset you want to replace.

Parameter.Name: otherTileset
Parameter.Abstract: The tileset you want to replace it with.

Token.Abstract: If tileset was replaced with replaceTileset: method, will restore it so that tiles will be drawn from this tileset again.
List of layers (KKTilemapLayer used by this map, in the draw order respectively the reverse order they appear in Tiled's Layers list (bottom-most = first, top-most = last).

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of KTTilemapLayer objects.

Token.Abstract: List of layers (KKTilemapLayer used by this map, in the draw order respectively the reverse order they appear in Tiled's Layers list (bottom-most = first, top-most = last).

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of KTTilemapLayer objects.

Token.Abstract: List of layers (KKTilemapLayer used by this map, in the draw order respectively the reverse order they appear in Tiled's Layers list (bottom-most = first, top-most = last).

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of KTTilemapLayer objects.

Token.Abstract: Adds a layer to the list of layers.
The name identifying a layer, as edited in Tiled.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name identifying a layer, as edited in Tiled.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The first layer with the given name, or nil if there's no layer with that name. Layer names are case-sensitive!
